gurmukhi: jYsy nwau bUfq sY joeI inksY soeI Blo bUif gey pwCy pCqwieE rih jwq hY
transliteration: Jaisay Naau Boodat Sai Joee Nikasai Soee Bhalo , Boodi Gaay Paachhay Pachhataaiao Rahi Jaat Hai ?
translation: Blessed are those who are saved from a capsizing boat. If drowned, there would be nothing but repentance.

gurmukhi: jYsy Gr lwgy Awig joeI bcY soeI Blo jir buJy pwCy kCu bsu n bswq hY
transliteration: Jaisay Ghar Laagay Aagi Joee Bachai Soee Bhalo , Jari Bujhay Paachhay Kachhu Basu N Basaat Hai ?
translation: All those who escape from a burning house are blessed people. Nothing can be done if one is burnt into ashes.

gurmukhi: jYsy cor lwgy jwgy joeI rhY soeI Blo soie gey rIqo Gr dyKY auiT pRwq hY
transliteration: Jaisay Chor Laagay Jaagay Joee Rahai Soee Bhalo , Soi Gaay Reeto Ghar Daykhai Outthi Praat Hai ?
translation: As one wakes up when the thief is committing theft, whatever is left behind by him is bonus and blessing. Otherwise one would find the house empty in the morning.

gurmukhi: qYsy AMq kwl gur crn srin AwvY pwvY moK pdvI nwqr ibllwq hY ]69]
transliteration: Taisay Ant Kaal Gur Charan Sarani Aavai , Paavai Mokh Padavee Naatar Bilalaat Hai ?69?
translation: Similarly if a wayward person comes to the refuge of Guru even at the near end of his life, he can achieve a state of emancipation. Otherwise he would fall in the hands of angels of death and keep wailing. (69)
